content: IDT - ES MDH | IDT | ES | IPR | Admin HomePeoplePublicationsOrganizationProjectsOpen PositionsAbout ESContactNewsEvents MDH Home IDT Home IDT Education Sasikumar Punnekkat, Professor E-mail: sasikumar.punnekkat@mdu.se Room: U1-070 Phone: +46-21-107324 Division: Division of Computer Science and Software Engineering Research groups: Dependable Software Engineering Real-Time Systems Design Systems-of-systems Web: Linkedin page BiographyResearchPublicationsProjectsPhD studentsMSc thesesSasikumar Punnekkat is a Professor in dependable software engineering at MDU and the leader of the Dependable Software Engineering research group. He has more than 15 years industrial experience as a scientist at the Indian Space research Organization, and was the Head of the Software test and reliability engineering. He was recipient of the prestigious Commonwealth Scholarship and was awarded Doctor of Philosophy in Computer Science by the University of York, UK in 1997 for his research on schedulability analysis of fault-tolerant systems. He was the Director of BITS-Pilani KK Birla Goa Campus during Mar 2015-Aug 2016. He was also a visiting researcher at Ericsson during April 2022-May 2025, with funding from the SSF's strategic mobility program.He has/had a lead role in many EU/National Projects such as InSecTT, SUCCESS, DAIS, ESCAPE-CD, DAISY, SIMCON, DOSTY, SAILS, FORA, RETNET, Progress, Synopsis, FiC , SafeCoP and SafeCer. He was the coordinator of large EU-funded projects EUROWEB, EUROWEB+ and EURECA, for research and educational collaboration between Europe and Western Balkan/Asia. He was the program director of the Master Programs in Software Engineering at MDH (2004-2015). His research interests include multiple aspects of Real-time Systems, Dependability, and Software Engineering. Dr Sasikumar Punnekkat has over 180 research publications in international conferences and journals (including 6 best paper awards). He is an Associate Editor of IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computing.  He is a senior memebr of IEEE and had been member of several Program commitees such as ETFA, IS, QoSA, HASE, DATE, SRDS, QSIC, RTCSA, SRDS, EFTS, RTiS,CONSEG, QUATIC, CERTS.Real-time systems, fault-tolerant computing, software engineering, functional safety, cyber security, software reliability, and software testing [Show all publications] [Google Scholar author page] Latest publications: Constellation-level Variability Modeling for Safety Constraint Refinement in System of Systems.
